title: Does anyone know what font is in this logo? (brand: TWIX)
author: Susana Bento

comments.content:
Custom, or heavily customized if it was based on a single typeface. Some typefaces that—with a little editing—could mimic the look:

Seconda Soft Standard Bold:  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/durotype/seconda-soft/basic-pack](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418010720/http:/www.fonts.com/font/durotype/seconda-soft/basic-pack "http://www.fonts.com/font/durotype/seconda-soft/basic-pack")

Barmeno Bold:  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/berthold/barmeno/be-volume](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418010720/http:/www.fonts.com/font/berthold/barmeno/be-volume "http://www.fonts.com/font/berthold/barmeno/be-volume")

Contax Sans 85 Black:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/contax-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418010720/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/contax-sans/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/contax-sans/")

Epoca Classic Bold:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hoftype/epoca-classic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418010720/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hoftype/epoca-classic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/hoftype/epoca-classic/")
I really appreciate your time! Thanks a lot !! I thought there was a specific font for this logo!

Good finds Kevin. To my eye Barmeno Bold is perhaps closest. It has about the right proportions and right degree of rounded corners. Main difference is that the SW to NE strokes are a little too thick. Sharpen some corners and notch the \_T\_ and it's pretty close. But Seconda Soft Bold is also good. Same comments.  
Don
